def merge_sort(lst):
    if len(lst) < 1:
        return lst
    mid = len(lst) // 2
    lst1 = merge_sort(lst[:mid])
    lst2 = merge_sort(lst[mid:])
    merged = []
    i = 0
    j = 0
    while i < len(lst1) and j < len(lst2):
        if lst1[i] <= lst2[j]:
            merged.append(lst1[i])
            i += 1
        else:
            merged.append(lst2[j])
            j += 1
    merged.extend(lst1[i:])
    merged.extend(lst2[j:])
    return merged
